summary: Remove the DataConverter requirement from header value objects in interceptors. Headers should be decoded on input and encoded only before sending, rather than requiring DataConverter dependency for header management.
userImpact: Simplifies interceptor API by removing unnecessary DataConverter dependency from header value objects, reducing coupling and improving usability.
rootCause: Current implementation requires DataConverter for header value objects even when headers don't need decoding, creating unnecessary coupling.
proposedFix: Decode headers immediately on input and encode them only before sending, eliminating the need to pass DataConverter to header value objects.
resolutionDetails: Issue was addressed by refactoring header handling to avoid DataConverter requirement in header value objects.
keyQuote: headers on input will be decoded immediately and packed again only before sending
